body: Zimbabwean blogger Chris Kabwato discusses the fate of political vultures: "Dictators are pseudo-intellectuals who have to invent some type of nationalism. They disguise their acts under the guise of sense of preserving tradition or returning to some African roots."
original_body: Zimbabwean blogger Chris Kabwato discusses the fate of political vultures: "Dictators are pseudo-intellectuals who have to invent some type of nationalism. They disguise their acts under the guise of sense of preserving tradition or returning to some African roots."
title: Africa: The fate of political vultures

sentence: Zimbabwean blogger Chris Kabwato discusses the fate of political vultures: "Dictators are pseudo-intellectuals who have to invent some type of nationalism.
They disguise their acts under the guise of sense of preserving tradition or returning to some African roots."
